io.sphere.client.filters

Interface Filter

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultiSelectFilter<T>, UserInputFilter<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Filters.Fulltext, Filters.NumberAttribute.Range, Filters.NumberAttribute.Selectable.Ranges, Filters.NumberAttribute.Selectable.Values, Filters.NumberAttribute.SingleValue, Filters.Price.DynamicRange, Filters.Price.Range, Filters.Price.Selectable.Ranges, Filters.Price.Selectable.Values, Filters.Price.SingleValue, Filters.StringAttribute.Selectable.Values, Filters.StringAttribute.SingleValue, MultiSelectFilterBase, UserInputAttributeFilterBase, UserInputFilterBase

    public interface Filter
    Filter 'component' that supports construction of backend queries based on application's URL query string. See FilterParser for reconstructing state of multiple filters from application's URL.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FilterExpression parse(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> queryString)
      Creates a backend query for this filter, based on current values in the application's query string.
      Filter setQueryParam(java.lang.String queryParam)
      Sets a custom query parameter name that will represent this filter in the application's query string.

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        FilterExpression parse(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> queryString)
        Creates a backend query for this filter, based on current values in the application's query string.

      • setQueryParam

        Filter setQueryParam(java.lang.String queryParam)
        Sets a custom query parameter name that will represent this filter in the application's query string.
